entries.name: Healing Hands
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and roll a number of d4s equal to your proficiency bonus. The creature regains a number of hit points equal to the total rolled. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Pactblood Descendent

entries.name: Age

entries.name: Necrotic Shroud
entries: You can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to turn into pools of darkness and two skeletal, ghostly, flightless wings to sprout from your back.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, creatures other than your allies within 10 feet of you that can see you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Age

entries.name: Radiant Soul
entries: You can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to glimmer and two luminous, incorporeal wings to sprout from your back.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Age

entries.name: Radiant Consumption
entries: You can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing a searing light to radiate from you, pour out of your eyes and mouth, and threaten to char you.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, each creature within 10 feet of you takes radiant damage equal to your proficiency bonus. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your proficiency bonus.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Mark of the Feywild
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
This trait gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier:

items.name: Spring
items.entry: When you teleport using this trait, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

items.name: Summer
items.entry: Immediately after you teleport using this trait, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

items.name: Autumn
items.entry: Immediately after you you teleport using this trait, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to the creatures.

items.name: Winter
items.entry: When you teleport using this trait, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Hidden Step

entries.name: Stampeding Step

A creature can avoid being shoved by making a successful Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check against a DC of 8 + your Strength ({@skill Athletics}) modifier. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Planar Vagabonds
entries: Foreigners to this world, the goblinoids traveled as four separate tribes across the elemental plane after the destruction of their home. Their god split their essence among four powerful artifacts to aid each tribe's expedition in finding a new home. Only three of the four tribes, however, have successfully made it to the world, and the artifacts have been lost in the multitude of conflicts since their arrival. Only three of the four tribes, however, have successfully made it to the world, and the artifacts have been lost in the multitude of conflicts since their arrival.

entries.name: Age
entries: It is unknown how long Soulforged live for as they show no sign of physical age. They are, however, prone to losing memories and can potentially stop functioning at any minute without warning, never to wake up.

entries.name: Arcane Automatons
entries: There have been many attempts in history to create artificial beings. The Soulforged of the Shattered Plains, being one of the more successful endeavors, were made by the Magisterium to serve as assistants to the mages, scholars, and artisans of their Enlightened City. Not many Soulforged survived the Night of Frozen Flames when the city burned down and was buried under the snow and ice of a year-long blizzard. Most living today were dug out by scavengers in the many years since, retaining only slivers of their memories from before the turmoil.

entries.name: Abyssal Legacy
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}, and you have resistance against poison damage. You also know the {@spell poison spray} cantrip and can cast the {@spell ray of sickness} spell once. Starting at 5th level, you gain the ability to cast the {@spell alter self} spell once. You must finish a long rest or spend a spell slot of the appropriate level to cast these spells again. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Age
entries: Tieflings live as long as their base lineage, but begin to show signs of age much later in life.

trait.name: Extraordinary Leap
entries: The distance of the steeder's long jumps is tripled; every foot of its walking speed that it spends on the jump allows it to move 3 feet.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The steeder can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Sticky Leg
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}The target is stuck to the steeder's leg and {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). The steeder can have only one creature {@condition grappled} at a time.
